questions.question: He died …………………….
questions.description: No article is used in this expression.

questions.question: I met some interesting people at ……………………….
questions.description: In American English, university is usually used with the article 'the'. In British English, 'the' can be omitted before university.

questions.question: He left …………………………….. in the morning and never came back.
questions.description: No article is used before home.

questions.question: I regret leaving ………………………….. at fourteen.
questions.description: No article is used in the expression leave school.

questions.question: I will meet you at ……………………………
questions.description: We use the article here because the college is just a meeting place.

questions.question: I was surprised at the amount of ……………………………. collected.
He went to ……………………………… in Cambridge.
questions.description: No article is normally used in this expression.

questions.question: It is time the children went to …………………………..
questions.description: No article is used in the expression 'go to bed'.

questions.question: I didn’t feel like getting out of …………………………
questions.description: No article is used in this expression.

questions.question: He is collecting money for …………………………….
questions.description: The blind means all blind people. The article ‘the’ is required in this expression.

questions.question: …………………………… criminals are non-violent.
questions.description: When most means the majority of, it is used without the.

questions.question: He could play …………………………. when he was just five.
questions.description: Articles are always used with the names of musical instruments.
